subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Something I forgot in some boxes
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
Well, not much time for people to wake up, less than 2.5 years. I can't
imagine every culture in the world having the exact same date in prophecy
and it means nothing.  I'm talking the 2012 thing, it's not just the Mayans.
It's in Europe, China, India, Egypt, Native Americans, the Bible, just to
name a few off the top of my head, plus it's from the GB as well.

 F-S

> GP

> Hi,
>
> I can only speak for myself, but here it is:
>
> Awhile ago, another skeptic (or two?) left the list, and I thought it was
> okay to post here. Then, "Rj" and friend filled in the skeptic gap, big
> time.
>
> I deal with enough critics and skeptics in the rest of my work. I don't
> work nearly as well when I'm upset, and fretting because someone has
> insulted me (or my intelligence) or someone I respect, like Frank.
>
> I'm learning that insulating myself allows me to focus on my work. If
> that's what I have to do... well, that's what I'll do.
>
> I've been in "wait and see" mode here, in case there are yet more critics
> and skeptics who'll fill in the "Rj" gap. I want to believe that
> everything's okay now, but I'm still stinging from recent negative comments,
> on and off of this list.
>
> But mostly, I'm about to leave for my biggest annual gig, in a field that's
> become more land mines than safe paths. Between the anxiety and the
> pre-event preps, I'm in lurk mode here... and I'll be offline entirely for
> most of the first two weeks of September.
>
> So, those are the reasons why I've been quiet.
>
> In haste,
> Fiona
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, Frank Sumption
> <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
> >
> > Soooo, the skeptic types are responsible for most of the dialog? Weird,
> > you'd think more would feel safer posting and commenting. Get rid of the
> > ones that accept no evidence, can't test, ignore all of our resutls,
> can't
> > hear and acuse us of halucinating this and---dead silence. Human
> psychology
> > is beyond my comprehension!
> >
> > F-S
> >
>
>
>  
>
